intro: Phagnalon saxatile proles telonense, commonly known as the Telonese stone everlasting, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It is a perennial herb characterized by its compact growth habit and grayish-blue foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, typically arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sun-exposed areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
